data.enText: caught
caught
hold
to stop and hold a moving object, especially in your hands
She managed to catch the keys as they fell.

data.chText: “请你把毛巾扔过来好吗？”“好，接住！”
data.enText: ‘Throw me over that towel, will you?’ ‘OK. Catch!’
The dog caught the stick in its mouth.
to hold a liquid when it falls

data.chText: 屋顶漏雨，我不得不用桶来接。
data.enText: The roof was leaking and I had to use a bucket to catch the drips.
to take hold of sb/sth

data.chText: 她试图从他身边挤过去时，他一把抓住了她的手臂。
data.enText: He caught hold of her arm as she tried to push past him.
capture
to capture a person or an animal that tries or would try to escape

data.chText: 这个杀人犯一直未抓到。
data.enText: The murderer was never caught.

data.chText: 我们的猫绝对捉不到老鼠。
data.enText: Our cat is hopeless at catching mice.
How many fish did you catch?
sb doing sth
to find or discover sb doing sth, especially sth wrong

data.chText: 我撞见她在盥洗室里抽烟。
data.enText: I caught her smoking in the bathroom.

data.chText: 你绝对不会看到我在星期日工作！
data.enText: You wouldn't catch me working (= I would never work) on a Sunday!

data.chText: 她发觉自己在怀疑是否犯了错误。
data.enText: She caught herself wondering whether she had made a mistake.

data.chText: 他被发现家里藏有制造炸弹的设备。
data.enText: He was caught with bomb-making equipment in his home.

data.chText: 马克走了进去，发现他们正在干坏事。
data.enText: Mark walked in and caught them at it (= in the act of doing sth wrong) .

data.chText: 偷窃时被当场抓住的窃贼
data.enText: thieves caught in the act

data.chText: 你现在来找我可不是时候。
data.enText: You've caught me at a bad time (= at a time when I am busy) .
be in time
to be in time to do sth, talk to sb, etc.

data.chText: 他正要离开大楼时，我追上了他。
data.enText: I caught him just as he was leaving the building.

data.chText: 我本希望赶上你在家的时候给你打电话。
data.enText: I was hoping to catch you at home (= to telephone you at home when you were there) .

data.chText: 此病若及早发现是可医治的。
data.enText: The illness can be treated provided it's caught (= discovered) early enough.
to catch the post (= post letters before the box is emptied)
Bye for now! I'll catch you later (= speak to you again later) .
bus/train/plane

data.chText: 赶上（公共汽车、火车、飞机等）
data.enText: to be in time for a bus, train, plane, etc. and get on it

data.chText: 我们赶上了12:15从牛津发出的火车。
data.enText: We caught the 12.15 from Oxford.
I must go─I have a train to catch.
happen unexpectedly
to happen unexpectedly and put sb in a difficult situation

data.chText: 他的到来让我感到意外。
data.enText: His arrival caught me by surprise .
She got caught in a thunderstorm.
see/hear
to see or hear sth; to attend sth

data.chText: 咱们现在就吃吧，也许还能赶上一场电影。
data.enText: Let's eat now and maybe we could catch a movie later.
illness
to get an illness
to catch measles

data.chText: 我的感冒想必是你传染的。
data.enText: I think I must have caught this cold from you.
become stuck
to become stuck in or on sth; to make sth become stuck

data.chText: 她的连衣裙被钉子钩住了。
data.enText: Her dress caught on a nail.
He caught his thumb in the door.
hit
to hit sb/sth

data.chText: 他头的侧面被石头击中。
data.enText: The stone caught him on the side of the head.

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+名词短语

data.enText: She caught him a blow on the chin.
notice
to notice sth only for a moment
She caught sight of a car in the distance.

data.chText: 他看了一眼镜子中的自己。
data.enText: He caught a glimpse of himself in the mirror.
I caught a look of surprise on her face.

data.chText: 他闻到一股她身上的香水味。
data.enText: He caught a whiff of her perfume.
hear/understand
to hear or understand sth

data.chText: 对不起，我没听清楚你的话。
data.enText: Sorry, I didn't quite catch what you said.
interest

data.chText: 引起，激发（兴趣、想象、注意等）
data.enText: if sth catches your interest, etc., you notice it and feel interested in it
show accurately
to show or describe sth accurately

data.chText: 艺术家惟妙惟肖地画出了她的微笑。
data.enText: The artist has caught her smile perfectly.
light
if sth catches the light or the light catches it, the light shines on it and makes it shine too
The knife gleamed as it caught the light .
the sun
if you catch the sun , you become red or brown because of spending time in the sun
burn
to begin to burn
The wooden rafters caught fire .

data.chText: 这些木柴是湿的，烧不着。
data.enText: These logs are wet: they won't catch.
in cricket
to make a player unable to continue batting by catching the ball they have hit before it touches the ground
catch your breath
to stop breathing for a moment because of fear, shock, etc.
to breathe normally again after running or doing some tiring exercise
catch your death (of cold)
to catch a very bad cold
catch sb's eye

data.chText: 引起某人注意；惹人注目
data.enText: to attract sb's attention

data.chText: 你能引起服务员的注意吗？
data.enText: Can you catch the waiter's eye?
catch it
catch hell
get it
to be punished or spoken to angrily about sth

data.chText: 要是你老爸知道了，你非挨骂不可！
data.enText: If your dad finds out you'll really catch it!
catch sb napping

data.chText: 使人措手不及；乘其不备
data.enText: to get an advantage over sb by doing sth when they are not expecting it and not ready for it
catch sb on the hop
to surprise sb by doing sth when they are not expecting it and not ready for it
catch sb red-handed
to catch sb in the act of doing sth wrong or committing a crime
catch sb with their pants down
catch sb with their trousers down

data.chText: 使突陷窘境；乘人措手不及；出其不意；冷不防
data.enText: to arrive or do sth when sb is not expecting it and not ready, especially when they are in an embarrassing situation
(catch/throw sb) off balance
to make sb/sth unsteady and in danger of falling

data.chText: 突如其来的一阵风差点儿把我吹倒。
data.enText: I was thrown off balance by the sudden gust of wind.

data.chText: 使（毫无准备而）不知所措
data.enText: to make sb surprised and no longer calm

data.chText: 参议员显然因这意想不到的问题而不知所措。
data.enText: The senator was clearly caught off balance by the unexpected question.
be (caught) in a cleft stick
to be in a difficult situation when any action you take will have bad results
catch/take sb's fancy
to attract or please sb

data.chText: 她仔细查看旅馆广告，终于有一家中了她的意。
data.enText: She looked through the hotel advertisements until one of them caught her fancy.
catch/touch sb on the raw

data.chText: 触到某人的痛处；揭某人的疮疤
data.enText: to upset sb by reminding them of sth they are particularly sensitive about
(caught/stuck) between a rock and a hard place
in a situation where you have to choose between two things, both of which are unpleasant
be caught short
be taken short

data.chText: 突然感觉要上厕所；内急
data.enText: to suddenly feel an urgent need to go to the toilet/bathroom
to be put at a disadvantage
catch at sth

data.text: = clutch at sth at clutch v.

data.enText: catch on

data.chText: 受欢迎；流行起来；变得时髦
data.enText: to become popular or fashionable

data.chText: 他发明了一种新的游戏，但从未真正流行起来。
data.enText: He invented a new game, but it never really caught on.
catch on (to sth)
to understand sth
He is very quick to catch on to things.
catch sb out
to surprise sb and put them in a difficult position

data.chText: 许多投资者由于股价下跌而突然陷入困境。
data.enText: Many investors were caught out by the fall in share prices.

data.chText: 抓住某人的短处；指出无知；指出过失
data.enText: to show that sb does not know much or is doing sth wrong

data.chText: 他们试图用一道难题难倒她。
data.enText: They tried to catch her out with a difficult question.
catch up on sth

data.chText: 补做（未做的事）；赶做；补上
data.enText: to spend extra time doing sth because you have not done it earlier
I have a lot of work to catch up on.
to find out about things that have happened

data.chText: 我们那一晚上都一直在彼此通报情况。
data.enText: We spent the evening catching up on each other's news.
be/get caught up in sth
to become involved in sth, especially when you do not want to be

data.chText: 无辜的过路人被卷入了那场暴乱。
data.enText: Innocent passers-by got caught up in the riots.
catch up (with sb)
catch sb up
to reach sb who is ahead by going faster
Go on ahead. I'll catch up with you.
I'll catch you up.
to reach the same level or standard as sb who was better or more advanced

data.chText: 他因病休学一学期，不得不努力学习好赶上别的同学。
data.enText: After missing a term through illness he had to work hard to catch up with the others.
catch up with sb

data.chText: 产生（曾设法避免的）问题
data.enText: to finally start to cause problems for sb after they have managed to avoid this for some time

data.chText: 她十分害怕过去的问题总有一天又会来困扰她。
data.enText: She was terrified that one day her past problems would catch up with her.
if the police or authorities catch up with sb, they find and punish them after some time

data.chText: 多年后当他已移居西班牙时最终还是受到法律的制裁。
data.enText: The law caught up with him years later when he had moved to Spain.
of ball
an act of catching sth, for example a ball
to make a catch
amount caught
the total amount of things that are caught
a huge catch of fish
fastening
a device used for fastening sth
a catch on the door
safety catches for the windows
difficulty

data.chText: 隐藏的困难；暗藏的不利因素
data.enText: a hidden difficulty or disadvantage

data.chText: 干了两小时的活就给那么多钱——这里面有什么鬼？
data.enText: All that money for two hours' work─what's the catch?
child's game
a child's game in which two people throw a ball to each other
person

data.chText: 理想的对象；意中人；雇用的好对象；看中的人
data.enText: a person that other people see as a good person to marry, employ, etc.
(a) catch-22
a catch-22 situation
a difficult situation from which there is no escape because you need to do one thing before doing a second, and you cannot do the second thing before doing the first

data.chText: 我没有住所就找不到工作，但是没有工作就没钱租房子——这真是左右为难。
data.enText: I can't get a job because I haven't got anywhere to live but I can't afford a place to live until I get a job─it's a catch-22 situation.

data.text: see ♦ spot ♦ catch ♦ glimpse ♦ clap/lay/set eyes on

data.chText: 以上各词均含看见、见到、看出之义，尤指突然发现或注意到。
data.enText: These words all mean to become aware of sb/sth by using your eyes, especially suddenly or when it is not easy to see them/it.
see
to become aware of sb/sth by using your eyes

data.chText: 她在人群里找来找去，但没看见他。
data.enText: She looked for him but couldn't see him in the crowd.
He could see (that) she had been crying.
spot

data.chText: 指看见、看出，尤指突然发现或注意到：
data.enText: to see or notice sb/sth, especially suddenly or when they are not easy to see or notice

data.chText: 我刚才在封面上发现了一处错误。
data.enText: I've just spotted a mistake on the front cover.
catch
to see or notice sth for a moment, but not clearly or completely
She caught sight of a car in the distance.

data.chText: 他看了一眼镜子中的自己。
data.enText: He caught a glimpse of himself in the mirror.
glimpse
( literary ) to see sb/sth for a moment, but not clearly or completely

data.chText: 他路过时透过窗户瞥见了她。
data.enText: He'd glimpsed her through the window as he passed.
clap/lay/set eyes on sb/sth

data.chText: （通常用于否定句中）指看见、注意到：
data.enText: ( informal ) (usually used in negative statements) to see sb/sth

data.chText: 我几个星期都没见到他们了。
data.enText: I haven't clapped eyes on them for weeks.
to see/spot that/how/what/where/who…
to suddenly see/spot/catch/glimpse sb/sth
can/could see
to fail to see/spot

ex.chText: 他被警察逮捕了。
ex.enText: He was arrested by the police.

ex.chText: 他朋友因诈骗被捕。
ex.enText: His friend was arrested for fraud.

synonyms.bx: 指对罪犯或犯罪嫌疑人进行拘捕并予以监禁或拘留。

ex.chText: 他在一次战斗中被俘。
ex.enText: He was captured in a battle.

ex.chText: 那只老虎终于被捕获了。
ex.enText: That tiger was finally captured.

synonyms.bx: 指通过使用武力或计谋等捉住人或动物并将其关押。

ex.chText: 警察抓住了那个窃贼。
ex.enText: The police caught the thief.

ex.chText: 猫捉老鼠。
ex.enText: The cat catches mice.

synonyms.bx: 普通用词，多指通过追踪、武力、突袭等捉住跑动或隐藏中的人或动物。

ex.chText: 那个小女孩突然抓住他的胳膊。
ex.enText: Suddenly the little girl seized his arm.

ex.chText: 谁抓住了受惊的马的缰绳？
ex.enText: Who seized the reins of the spooked horse?

ex.chText: 在纽约，你有没有在深夜单独乘过地铁？
ex.enText: In New York, did you ever take the subway alone late at night?

ex.chText: 我更愿意乘飞机去。
ex.enText: I would rather take the plane.

ex.chText: 到十字路口走右边的岔道。
ex.enText: Take the right fork at the crossroads.

synonyms.bx: 普通用词，指乘坐某种交通工具或走某条道路。

ex.chText: 我和德雷克决定乘火车去日内瓦。
ex.enText: Drake and I decided to board a train for Geneva.

ex.chText: 我们在8号登机口登机。
ex.enText: We're boarding at gate 8.

ex.chText: 我们加入到等候上船的旅客队伍中。
ex.enText: We joined the passengers waiting to board.

ex.chText: 他起得很早，以便赶上头班火车。
ex.enText: He got up very early so as to catch the first train.

ex.chText: 他突然发现时间很晚，赶不上末班公共汽车了。
ex.enText: He suddenly discovered that it was too late to catch the last bus.

ex.chText: 她正要离开办公室去赶飞往伦敦的一班飞机。
ex.enText: She was about to leave the office to catch a flight to London.

synonyms.bx: 指及时登上飞机、火车、公共汽车等。

ex.chText: 他们一早就登上了开往迈阿密的轮船。
ex.enText: Early in the morning they embarked the ship for Miami.

ex.chText: 他在伦敦上的船。
ex.enText: He embarked at London.

ex.chText: 这艘船载有旅客和货物。
ex.enText: This ship embarked passengers and cargoes.

synonyms.bx: 主要指乘船，也可指船载运旅客、货物。

ex.chText: 查票员上了火车。
ex.enText: A ticket inspector got on the train.

ex.chText: 当公共汽车到站时，一些乘客上了车。
ex.enText: When the bus came to a stop, some passengers got on.

ex.chText: 我们在巴黎上的飞机。
ex.enText: We got on the plane at Paris.

synonyms.bx: 指上车、船、飞机等，多用于非正式文体。

ex.zh: 搭乘公共汽车/航班/飞机/火车
玩抛接球游戏；玩捉人游戏

trans: 明白；懂得；认识到
时兴；流行
使原形毕露；抓住…的短处
赶上；追上；跟上
赶上，达到（标准、水平等）
补做；赶做
了解近况；叙旧
牵扯进；卷入
捕获，擒获，捉拿到（犯错者）
和…算旧账；使…最终尝到苦果

tr: the act of apprehending (especially apprehending a criminal)
example: the policeman on the beat got credit for the collar

tr: the act of catching an object with the hands
example: Mays made the catch with his back to the plate
he made a grab for the ball before it landed
Martin's snatch at the bridle failed and the horse raced away
the infielder's snap and throw was a single motion

tr: a cooperative game in which a ball is passed back and forth
example: he played catch with his son in the backyard

tr: a fastener that fastens or locks a door or window
a restraint that checks the motion of something
example: he used a book as a stop to hold the door open

tr: a drawback or difficulty that is not readily evident
example: it sounds good but what's the catch?

tr: a break or check in the voice (usually a sign of strong emotion)
anything that is caught (especially if it is worth catching)
example: he shared his catch with the others

tr: a person regarded as a good matrimonial prospect
the quantity that was caught
example: the catch was only 10 fish

tr: contract
example: did you catch a cold?

tr: delay or hold up
prevent from proceeding on schedule or as planned
example: I was caught in traffic and missed the meeting

tr: be struck or affected by
example: catch fire
catch the mood

tr: grasp with the mind or develop an understanding of
example: did you catch that allusion?
We caught something of his theory in the lecture
don't catch your meaning
did you get it?
She didn't get the joke
I just don't get him

tr: detect a blunder or misstep
example: The reporter tripped up the senator

tr: discover or come upon accidentally, suddenly, or unexpectedly
catch somebody doing something or in a certain state
example: She caught her son eating candy
She was caught shoplifting

tr: become aware of
example: he caught her staring out the window

tr: be the catcher
example: Who is catching?

tr: catch up with and possibly overtake
example: The Rolls Royce caught us near the exit ramp

tr: succeed in catching or seizing, especially after a chase
example: We finally got the suspect
Did you catch the thief?

tr: to hook or entangle
example: One foot caught in the stirrup

tr: cause to become accidentally or suddenly caught, ensnared, or entangled
example: I caught the hem of my dress in the brambles

tr: spread or be communicated
example: The fashion did not catch

tr: reach with a blow or hit in a particular spot
example: the rock caught her in the back of the head
The blow got him in the back
The punch caught him in the stomach

tr: take hold of so as to seize or restrain or stop the motion of
example: Catch the ball!
Grab the elevator door!

tr: capture as if by hunting, snaring, or trapping
example: I caught a rabbit in the trap today

tr: take in and retain
example: We have a big barrel to catch the rainwater

tr: attract and fix
example: His look caught her
She caught his eye
Catch the attention of the waiter

tr: apprehend and reproduce accurately
example: She really caught the spirit of the place in her drawings
She got the mood just right in her photographs

tr: attract
cause to be enamored
example: She captured all the men's hearts

tr: reach in time
example: I have to catch a train at 7 o'clock

tr: suffer from the receipt of
example: She will catch hell for this behavior!

tr: perceive with the senses quickly, suddenly, or momentarily
example: I caught the aroma of coffee
He caught the allusion in her glance
ears open to catch every sound
The dog picked up the scent
Catch a glimpse

tr: see or watch
example: view a show on television
This program will be seen all over the world
view an exhibition
Catch a show on Broadway
see a movie

tr: hear, usually without the knowledge of the speakers
example: We overheard the conversation at the next table

tr: perceive by hearing
example: I didn't catch your name
She didn't get his name when they met the first time

tr: get or regain something necessary, usually quickly or briefly
example: Catch some sleep
catch one's breath

tr: check oneself during an action
example: She managed to catch herself before telling her boss what was on her mind

tr: start burning
example: The fire caught

value.def: If you catch a person or animal, you capture them after chasing them, or by using a trap, net, or other device.

example.ex: Police say they are confident of catching the gunman...
example.tran: 警方说他们有信心抓住那个持枪歹徒。

example.ex: Where did you catch the fish?...
example.tran: 这条鱼你在哪儿逮的？

example.ex: I wondered if it was an animal caught in a trap.
example.tran: 我在想，会不会是什么动物掉进了陷阱。

value.def: If you catch an object that is moving through the air, you seize it with your hands.

example.ex: I jumped up to catch a ball and fell over.
example.tran: 我跳起来接球，结果摔了个跟头。

example.ex: He missed the catch and the match was lost.
example.tran: 他没有接住球，比赛输了。

value.def: If you catch a part of someone's body, you take or seize it with your hand, often in order to stop them going somewhere.

example.ex: Liz caught his arm...
example.tran: 莉兹一把抓住了他的胳膊。

example.ex: He knelt beside her and caught her hand in both of his...
example.tran: 他跪在她的旁边，双手握住她的一只手。

example.ex: Garrido caught her by the wrist.
example.tran: 加里多抓住她的手腕。

value.def: If one thing catches another, it hits it accidentally or manages to hit it.

example.ex: The stinging slap almost caught his face...
example.tran: 那狠狠的一巴掌差点搧在他脸上。

example.ex: I may have caught him with my elbow but it was just an accident...
example.tran: 也许我的胳膊肘碰到了他，但那是无意的。

example.ex: He caught her on the side of her head with his other fist.
example.tran: 他的另一只拳头从侧面击中她的头部。

value.def: If something catches on or in an object or if an object catches something, it accidentally becomes attached to the object or stuck in it.

example.ex: Her ankle caught on a root, and she almost lost her balance...
example.tran: 她的脚踝被树根绊了一下，差点摔倒。

example.ex: A man caught his foot in the lawnmower.
example.tran: 有个男的一只脚绞进剪草机里了。

value.def: When you catch a bus, train, or plane, you get on it in order to travel somewhere.

example.ex: We were in plenty of time for Anthony to catch the ferry...
example.tran: 我们时间充裕得很，足够安东尼赶上渡船。

example.ex: He caught a taxi to Harrods.
example.tran: 他打了辆出租车去哈罗德百货商店。

value.def: If you catch someone doing something wrong, you see or find them doing it.

example.ex: He caught a youth breaking into a car...
example.tran: 他撞见一个青年正在撬车。

example.ex: I don't want to catch you pushing yourself into the picture to get some personal publicity...
example.tran: 我不希望看见你为了出风头而去抢镜头。

example.ex: Three years ago my wife and I divorced. I caught her with her boss.
example.tran: 3年前，我和老婆离了婚。我发现她和她老板有染。

value.tran: 撞见，当场抓住(某人做坏事)

value.def: If you catch yourself doing something, especially something surprising, you suddenly become aware that you are doing it.

example.ex: I caught myself feeling almost sorry for poor Mr Laurence.
example.tran: 我突然发觉自己几乎同情起可怜的劳伦斯先生来了。

value.def: If you catch something or catch a glimpse of it, you notice it or manage to see it briefly.

example.ex: As she turned back she caught the puzzled look on her mother's face...
example.tran: 她转过身来，看见母亲脸上迷惑的表情。

example.ex: He caught a glimpse of the man's face in a shop window.
example.tran: 他在商店橱窗里瞥见了一眼那个人的脸。

example.ex: Often a fox goes across the road in front of me and I just catch it in the headlights.
example.tran: 常常有狐狸穿越车前方的马路，我借助车头灯正好看见。

value.def: If you catch something that someone has said, you manage to hear it.

example.ex: His ears caught a faint cry...
example.tran: 他听到一声微弱的叫声。

example.ex: I do not believe I caught your name...
example.tran: 我没有听清你的名字。

example.ex: The men out in the corridor were trying to catch what they said.
example.tran: 外面走廊里的人竖起耳朵想听他们说些什么。

value.def: If you catch a TV or radio programme or an event, you manage to see or listen to it.

example.ex: Bill turns on the radio to catch the local news...
example.tran: 比尔打开收音机，收听本地新闻。

example.ex: The exhibition is on at Droitwich until May 24. You can also catch it at Leominster from June 5.
example.tran: 展览在德罗伊特威奇一直持续到5月24日。从6月5日起，还可以在莱姆斯特参观该展览。

value.tran: 观看，收看，收听(电视或电台节目)

value.def: If you catch someone, you manage to contact or meet them to talk to them, especially when they are just about to go somewhere else.

example.ex: I dialled Elizabeth's number thinking I might catch her before she left for work...
example.tran: 我拨了伊丽莎白的号码，心里想或许能赶在她去上班前联系到她。

example.ex: Hello, Dolph. Glad I caught you.
example.tran: 喂，多尔夫，可见着你了。

value.def: If something or someone catches you by surprise or at a bad time, you were not expecting them or do not feel able to deal with them.

example.ex: She looked as if the photographer had caught her by surprise...
example.tran: 看上去，她好像被摄影师搞了个猝不及防。

example.ex: I'm sorry but I just cannot say anything. You've caught me at a bad time...
example.tran: 对不起，我真的没什么好说的。你问得不是时候。

example.ex: The sheer number of spectators has caught everyone unprepared.
example.tran: 观众的人数之多让所有人措手不及。

value.tran: 使惊慌失措;使措手不及

value.def: If something catches your attention or your eye, you notice it or become interested in it.

example.ex: My shoes caught his attention...
example.tran: 我的鞋子引起了他的注意。

example.ex: A quick movement across the aisle caught his eye.
example.tran: 有个人影在走道里一闪而过，引起了他的注意。

value.def: If someone or something catches a mood or an atmosphere, they successfully represent it or reflect it.

example.ex: There's no doubt Mr Putin's speech caught the mood of most deputies.
example.tran: 无疑，普金先生的讲话充分反映了大多数代表的心情。

value.def: If you are caught in a storm or other unpleasant situation, it happens when you cannot avoid its effects.

example.ex: When he was fishing off the island he was caught in a storm and almost drowned...
example.tran: 他出岛捕鱼时，赶上一场暴风雨，差点淹死。

example.ex: Visitors to the area were caught between police and the rioters.
example.tran: 到该地区游玩的人碰上警察和骚乱分子交战。

value.def: If you are caught between two alternatives or two people, you do not know which one to choose or follow.

example.ex: The Jordanian leader is caught between both sides in the dispute...
example.tran: 争论双方使约旦领导人左右为难。

example.ex: She was caught between envy and admiration.
example.tran: 她不知是该妒忌还是该羡慕。

value.tran: (在两难中)不知如何选择，不知所措

value.def: If you catch a cold or a disease, you become ill with it.

example.ex: The more stress you are under, the more likely you are to catch a cold.
example.tran: 压力越大，越有可能患感冒。

value.def: To catch liquids or small pieces that fall from somewhere means to collect them in a container.

example.ex: The fish is laid out on a large serving plate to catch the juices.
example.tran: 鱼盛在一个大盘子里，以防汤汁洒出来。

example.ex: ...a specially designed breadboard with a tray to catch the crumbs.
example.tran: 特制的切面包板，有个能接住面包屑的槽

value.def: If something catches the light or if the light catches it, it reflects the light and looks bright or shiny.

example.ex: They saw the ship's guns, catching the light of the moon...
example.tran: 他们看到船上的大炮在月光下熠熠生辉。

value.def: If the wind or water catches something, it carries or pushes it along.

example.ex: A gust of wind caught the parachute.
example.tran: 一阵风将降落伞吹远。

value.def: A catch on a window, door, or container is a device that fastens it.

example.ex: She fiddled with the catch of her bag...
example.tran: 她摆弄着包上的搭扣。

example.ex: Fit windows with safety locks or catches.
example.tran: 给窗户装上安全锁或窗栓。

value.def: A catch is a hidden problem or difficulty in a plan or an offer that seems surprisingly good.

example.ex: The catch is that you work for your supper, and the food and accommodation can be very basic...
example.tran: 圈套在于你是在挣钱糊口，但食宿其实有可能非常简单。

example.ex: 'It's your money. You deserve it.' — 'What's the catch?'
example.tran: “这钱归你，你该拿这个钱。”——“搞什么名堂？”

value.def: When people have been fishing, their catch is the total number of fish that they have caught.

example.ex: The catch included one fish over 18 pounds.
example.tran: 捕获的鱼里有一条重逾18磅。

value.def: If you describe someone as a good catch, you mean that they have lots of good qualities and you think their partner or employer is very lucky to have found them.

example.ex: I was so in love with him and all my friends said what a good catch he was.
example.tran: 我当时和他陷入热恋，我的朋友们都说能找到他是我的福气。

value.def: Catch is a game in which children throw a ball to each other.
Catch is a game in which one child chases other children and tries to touch or catch one of them.
You can say things such as 'You wouldn't catch me doing that' to emphasize that you would never do a particular thing.

example.ex: You won't catch me giving him a bad review!...
example.tran: 我绝不会说他坏话的。

example.ex: You wouldn't catch me in there, I can tell you.
example.tran: 我可以告诉你，你永远别想在那里看见我。

value.def: If someone is caught with their pants down, something happens that they are not prepared for and that reveals something embarrassing or shocking about them. In British English, you can also say that they are caught with their trousers down .

example.ex: It makes soldiers happy to know that somebody right at the top has been caught with his trousers down...
example.tran: 顶头上司出了大洋相，当兵的最高兴了。

example.ex: I think we caught them with their pants down. They're a bit confused.
example.tran: 我觉得我们让他们下不了台了。他们有点不知所措。

value.tran: 使猝不及防；使极其尴尬;使突陷窘境

xrse.def: to be caught between a rock and a hard place

trans: 发觉自己讲错而突然住嘴
赶上进度；赶上；追上；跟上；达到（标准、水平等）；补做；赶做；了解近况；叙旧；牵扯进；卷入
赶上；捕获，擒获，捉拿到（犯错者）；和…算旧账；使…最终尝到苦果
明白；懂得；认识到；时兴；流行
乘坐火车；赶火车
捕鱼；钓鱼；打鱼；捉鱼
赶完；对…有影响；事后得到关于…的消息
激动人心;赢得成功；着火;起火;开始燃烧
略见一斑
绊倒…；给…绊了一下；遇上雨，被雨淋；恰遇某人在（说明）catch in作此解时常不用于进行体。
设法抓住或利用；发现某人正在干…；接受
抓住， 握住
捕捉遗漏；一把抓；捕捉所有；设立预设帐号
无法呼吸；屏住呼吸；无法喘气；屏息以待；停下来缓缓气
待会儿见
(常指名人常说的) 时髦话，流行语
醒目
赶公交车；赶车；赶上公共汽车；赶公车；赶上公交车
锁扣，停止档，闭锁掣子
接球
